ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
The Google Cloud RuntimeConfig API enables developers to dynamically configure and expose variables through Google Cloud Platform. In addition, you can also set Watchers and Waiters that will watch for changes to your data and return based on certain conditions.
See the [quick start guide](https://googleapis.dev/python/runtimeconfig/latest/index.html#quick-start).
about.summary: Google Cloud RuntimeConfig API client library

about.description:
The Google Cloud RuntimeConfig API enables developers to dynamically configure and expose variables through Google Cloud Platform. In addition, you can also set Watchers and Waiters that will watch for changes to your data and return based on certain conditions.
See the [quick start guide](https://googleapis.dev/python/runtimeconfig/latest/index.html#quick-start).
about.summary: Google Cloud RuntimeConfig API client library

name: google-cloud-runtimeconfig
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "google-cloud-runtimeconfig" %}
{% set version = "0.36.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name | replace('-', '_') }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: fa90c5c842e89414c97f3fd122835b18d1c2df4b722a167b0fa5e241328edadd

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - google-cloud-core >=1.4.4,<3.0.0

test:
  imports:
    - google.cloud.client
    - google.cloud.runtimeconfig
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}

about:
  home: https://github.com/googleapis/python-runtimeconfig
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_family: Apache
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Google Cloud RuntimeConfig API client library
  description: "The Google Cloud RuntimeConfig API enables developers to dynamically configure and expose variables through Google Cloud Platform. In addition, you can also set Watchers and Waiters that will watch for changes to your data and return based on certain conditions.\nSee the [quick start guide](https://googleapis.dev/python/runtimeconfig/latest/index.html#quick-start)."

  doc_url: https://googleapis.dev/python/runtimeconfig/latest/index.html
  dev_url: https://github.com/googleapis/python-runtimeconfig

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - xylar
    - parthea
